post_text: One of my favorite 6th grade traditions is Pumpkin-ology. Students spent Halloween studying the math and science of pumpkins. We found the height, weight, circumference, mass, volume, and density pumpkins. We counted the seeds and the cafeteria roasted them a special afternoon snack. After we learned all we could from our pumpkins, we brought them back to nature and had a pumpkin throwing contest. In the afternoon we explored the creative side of pumpkins by writing short comics from the perspective of a pumpkin and painting pumpkins to depict a theme from our current book club groups. Pumpkin-ology is great way to celebrate a Halloween!

post_text: Our 6th graders had the wonderful opportunity to meet with a local author, Dinah Mack. We read her book, The Pirates of Cologne and had the opportunity to discuss her writing process.
shared_text:
The Pirates of Cologne
April 24, 2018 at 8:17 PM ·

I had an AMAZING time talking with 6th graders from Hatfield Elementary School today. Their questions were so thoughtful and interesting and made me think about what I had written in a whole new way. They wanted to know about the writing process, choices I had made with certain characters, how I did my research, and even asked me to write a sequel. I loved every minute of the visit. Give my book a chance- your students will take a great deal from reading it and I would love to come meet them!
